title: A1 under construction
content:
**Hi!** I've been following the discussions on this forum for a while now - and it has been very inspiring to see the work in progress here. I've been working on this font (working title: A1) for a couple of weeks and would like to have some critique. The missing glyphs of the l/c plus all of the u/c glyphs still need some (lots of) work, but I would like to hear your comments before I move along. The font is partly based on the _superellipse_ (thanx to _Herman Zapf_ and this discussion board for introducing me to the superellipse) and its stems and hairlines has the same width as _Helvetica Neue 55 Roman_ - so the uploaded image is an example of A1 roman (regular). Other weights will perhaps follow. **Tor**
Font A1.swf

I think this is pretty cool.   
Reminds me a bit of FF Signa, although it's more "free".   
   
hhp

**Hello Hrant**   
   
Thank you for the kind words. What exactly do you mean by "free"?   
   
I'm wondering if there isn't a problem with the arm of the l/c "e" - because of being parallel to the baseline it seems to "hang" under it - especially if followed by a round shape (the bowl in g or q).   
   
 ![A1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414172139im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/2522.gif)   
   
And what about the "a" - it's the only glyph that has a terminal - that is maybe too exotic if its the only terminal in the whole face?   
   
By the way: FF Signa is drawn by danish designer _Ole Soendergaard_ and I must admit that I admire that particular face quite a lot. This shouldn't be too obvious though ...   
   
**Tor**

\> What exactly do you mean by "free"?   
   
Less rigid.   
   
I think your "e" is fine - maybe a bit wide.   
The "a" has a terminal? Is it in white? :-/   
   
hhp

**Tor**
